sentences.sContent: If, say, ideal is to successful a boat, so, I'll take good rudder.
sentences.sContent_eng: If, say, ideal is to successful a boat, so, I'll take good rudder.
sentences.sCn: 如果说，理想是驶向成功的一艘小船，那么，我一定会把好船舵。

sentences.sContent: If unfurling your sails before the storm you snap the rudder in two.
sentences.sContent_eng: If unfurling your sails before the storm you snap the rudder in two.
sentences.sCn: 如果你在风暴前扯起船帆，你把船舵折成两半。

sentences.sContent: If the ideal is to succeed in a small boat, then, I will take good rudder.
sentences.sContent_eng: If the ideal is to succeed in a small boat, then, I will take good rudder.
sentences.sCn: 如果说，理想是驶向成功的一艘小船，那么，我一定会把好船舵。

trans.tranOther: a flat part at the back of a ship or aircraft that can be turned in order to control the direction in which it moves
